posts.name: Shawn
posts.cooked:
image 4032×3024 2.51 MB image 4032×3024 2.23 MB How do I set up this TP Link network switch with two limelight’s? Do I need a radio power module? How would I connect the network switch to the robot radio with the power adapter? Is it not possible to connect two limelight’s with this network switch?

image 4032×3024 2.51 MB

image 4032×3024 2.51 MB

image 4032×3024 2.23 MB

image 4032×3024 2.23 MB

posts.name: John Fogarty
posts.cooked:
The powered side of the POE injector goes into the radio. The other end of the POE injector you run an Ethernet cable to the switch.

You run an Ethernet patch cable to the switch from the RoboRIO.

You run an Ethernet patch cable from the switch to your limelight. ( if you are doing POE for the limelight it’s the same as the radio… powered side to Limelight and the Ethernet to the switch.) Repeat for the 2nd Limelight.

posts.name: John Fogarty
posts.cooked:
Your photo doesn’t show you have one. It would either a black or bright orange network cable with an extra set of power wires running off of one end. There is a black version from years last that has a barrel plug from one end.

From your photo you are just using a black/red power wire from your main power panel to a barrel connector into your radio.

So you just run the Ethernet cables all into the switch from each device and then make sure each device has power from the Power Distribution Hub.

Make sure you are supplying the correct power to the devices. The radio and limelight’s are 12V but that switch is a 5V power device I think.

posts.name: Shawn
posts.cooked:
image 1920×958 299 KB Would it be something like this?

image 1920×958 299 KB

image 1920×958 299 KB

posts.name: John Fogarty
posts.cooked:
Yea that’s how you can do it.

It’s funny I forget about the REV radio power module… when we use one.

posts.name: dirtbikerxz
posts.cooked:
JohnFogarty:

Yea that’s how you can do it.

@chonkrdoggr Do not use the RPM to power the LL . You will most likely damage the LL . The LL takes in 12v, the RPM outputs 18v. image 391×213 8.36 KB

image 391×213 8.36 KB

image 391×213 8.36 KB

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: You can power the limelight directly off the PDP/PDH.

posts.name: John Fogarty
posts.cooked: When looking at the diagram he showed the module is plugged into the Radio not the limelight.

posts.name: Shawn
posts.cooked: @Peter_Johnson Yes, would I need the Ethernet switch to be connnected to the radio for the two limelight’s to work?

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: Yes; your diagram above is correct.

posts.name: Shawn
posts.cooked: @JohnFogarty @Peter_Johnson @dirtbikerxz So what I’m taking away from this is to connect the Ethernet switch to the radio via Ethernet cable, then connect the switch to the PDP via power adaptor cable, then I can plug in the limelight’s using Ethernet cables to the Ethernet switch?

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: No.  Your wiring of Ethernet in the image you posted previously is correct.  Power wise all of these pieces except the radio itself (eg RPM, switch, limelight, and Rio) plug into the PDH/PDH.

posts.name: Shawn
posts.cooked: Ok, so I power the switch via the PDP/PDH and the RoboRio, then plug both limelights into the switch?

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked:
I’m a little unsure what you’re describing by “plug”, as nearly all of these devices require two separate things to be connected: power and Ethernet.

You need these Ethernet connections:

Radio to RPM

RPM to switch

Limelight 1 to switch

Limelight 2 to switch

RoboRIO to switch

You need these Power connections:

PDP/PDH to RPM

PDP/PDH to switch

PDP/PDH to Limelight 1

PDP/PDH to Limelight 2

PDP/PDH to RoboRIO

posts.name: Shawn
posts.cooked: Thank you, we got it working
